trial_identification.studytitle: Extracorporeal Membrane Oxygenation (ECMO) in adults: physical and mental health after hospitalisation.
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Physical and mental health outcomes in critically ill adults treated with Extracorporeal Membrane Oxygenation (ECMO) in Intensive Care Units (ICUs).

conditions.healthcondition: Extracorporeal membrane oxygenation for lung and or heart failure

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Studies of normal psychology, cognitive function and behaviour

interventions.interventions:
Prospective observational study 3,6,12 and 18 months post discharge using quantitative surveys to assess health related quality of life and mental health followed by a limited number of semi-structured qualitative interviews with patients and relatives.
Patients will be surveyed once at 3,6,12 and 18 months after discharge. Relatives that participate in the interviews will be surveyed once at the time of the interview.
10 interviews with patients and 10 interviews with relatives for approximate 1,5 hours each will be conducted 12 months after discharge from the hospital. Patients and relatives will be interviewed once only. Interviews will cover the experience of ECMO treatment before and after discharge.
interventions.comparator:
Patients treated with venous venous (VV) or venous arterial (VA) ECMO
Relatives

primaryOutcome.outcome:
Health related quality of life, cognitive functioning; and depression, anxiety and post-traumatic stress disorder risk in patients 3 and 6 months after ECMO.
Short Form 36 Health survey (SF-36) EQ-5D-5L survey (EQ-5D) Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS) Telephone Interview for Cognitive Status (TICS) Impact of Event Scale (revised) (IES-R)
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Separate at 3 and 6 months after ECMO

primaryOutcome.outcome:
Health related quality of life, cognitive functioning; and depression, anxiety and post-traumatic stress disorder risk in patients 12 and 18 months after ECMO.
Short Form 36 Health survey (SF-36) EQ-5D-5L survey (EQ-5D) Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS) Telephone Interview for Cognitive Status (TICS) Impact of Event Scale (revised) (IES-R)
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Separate at 12 and 18 months after ECMO

primaryOutcome.outcome:
Patient's and relative's perception and experience with ECMO treatment
Exploration of themes that relate to patient's and relative's perception and experience with ECMO treatment and its impact on health outcomes via interviews using thematic analysis.
Interviews

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Differences in survey scores between VV and VA subgroups
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Separate at 3,6,12 and 18 months after ECMO

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Patients who are 18 years or older, admitted to ICU and treated with ECMO from 2013 2014/15.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Patients or relatives who do not speak English; cognitive / neurological impairments which would preclude completion of interviews or surveys; terminal conditions.

trial_design.statisticalmethods:
Quantitative data: descriptive statistics
Qualitative data: thematic analysis

ethicsAndSummary.summary: Prospective observational study 3,6,12 and 18 months post discharge using quantitative surveys to assess health related quality of life and mental health followed by a limited number of semi-structured qualitative interviews with patients and relatives.
ethicsAndSummary.publication: A qualitative exploration of acute care and psychological distress experiences of ECMO survivors. Heart Lung. 2016 Feb 22. pii: S0147-9563(16)00011-X. doi: 10.1016/j.hrtlng.2016.01.010.
